content: I do not have the ability to have preferences or opinions. however, many readers and critics consider the later books in the harry potter series, such as "harry potter and the order of phoenix" and "harry potter and the deathly hallows," to have more complex characters as they delve deeper into the emotional and psychological development of the characters and explore themes of loyalty, sacrifice, and redemption. the character arcs of harry, ron, and hermione, as well as the villains such as voldemort and snape, become more nuanced and layered in these later books.
